title: Lord Ludwig von Graustein
atAGlance:
**Lord Ludwig von Graustein** - Lord of the Grey Stone, "The Stone Lord"

- Ancient family in terminal decline, clinging to a crumbling domain
- Stubborn old man who refuses to accept his house is dying
- Sons fighting over who will inherit the ruins
- Drowning in debt to Lord Belmont
- *Common saying: "Graustein endures like stoneâ€”cold, cracking, and soon to crumble."*

| | |
|---|---|
| **Age** | 61 |
| **Seat** | Graustein Castle |
| **Region** | Eastern highlands |
| **Allegiance** | The past |
| **Threat Level** | Low (but succession is dangerous) |

---
commonKnowledge:
### Appearance & Manner
Aged, shrinking, still tries to stand tall. White hair, rheumy grey eyes. Trembling hands he tries to hide. Dresses in outdated finery. Looks like a man fighting time and losing. Speaks of past glories that fewer remember each year.

### Personality
Stubborn to the point of self-destruction. Refuses to accept family's decline. Lives in the past. Cruel to his sons (blames them for everything). Proud beyond reason. Will die before admitting failure.

### Family
- **Wife:** Lady Margrit (deceased 10 years) - Her death accelerated the decline.
- **Heir:** Aldric (38) - Believes he's owed the lordship. Bitter, scheming, would sell the domain to fund his lifestyle.
- **Second Son:** Berthold (35) - Actually competent. Works in the mines himself. Father dismisses him.
- **Sisters:** Vivienne (52, married to Lord Belmont), Helene (47, married to Lord Rotfels).

### Domain & Decline
Rules ~8,000 people (emigrating to better domains). Eastern highlands with exhausted silver mines. Commands 1,000 poorly equipped, demoralized soldiers. Owes Belmont enormous debt. Domain is visibly collapsing.

### Political Position
Too weak to matter, too proud to ask for help. Other Lords watch the succession with interestâ€”or predatory intent. King prefers stability but won't intervene.

---
secretKnowledge:
### True Nature
Ludwig is exactly the stubborn, proud, failing patriarch he appears. There's no hidden depthâ€”just a man who inherited a weakened house, made poor decisions that accelerated the fall, and now refuses to admit the truth. His cruelty to his sons comes from displaced self-hatred.

### The Real Numbers
- **Debt to Belmont:** 20,000 gold (crushing, unpayable)
- **Population:** Declining yearly as people flee
- **Mines:** Silver nearly exhausted, some iron remains
- **Military:** Would struggle against any serious threat
- Charles Belmont effectively owns Graustein already

### The Empty Vaults
Family treasures have been sold over decades:
- The famous "Graustein Jewels" are paste copies
- Artwork replaced with reproductions
- Only Ludwig knows the full extent
- He refuses to admit it even to himself

### The Succession Crisis
Two sons, both with claims, both with plans:

**Aldric (Heir):**
- Corrupt, incompetent, in personal debt
- Has promised Blackthorne the eastern passes in exchange for support
- Would strip the domain to pay his debts
- Might accelerate father's death

**Berthold (Second Son):**
- Actually competent, works the mines
- Has found a new silver vein (secret)
- Could save the domain if he inherited
- Legally cannot inherit over living elder brother

### The Blackthorne Deal
Aldric has promised Edmund Blackthorne:
- Alliance and support when Aldric becomes Lord
- Control of the strategic eastern passes
- Would functionally surrender the domain

Berthold suspects but can't prove. This deal could shift Kingdom power balance.

### The Last Vein
Berthold has found a new silver deposit:
- Hasn't told father or brother
- Could save the domain if properly exploited
- Waiting for the right moment
- If Aldric learns, he'll sell the information to Blackthorne

### Vivienne's Intelligence
Ludwig's sister at Belmont sends information:
- Warns about Aldric's schemes
- Also feeds Belmont intelligence about Graustein
- Conflicted loyalties
- Charles Belmont knows everything about Graustein's situation

### What Ludwig Wants
- To die before seeing final collapse
- Family glory restored (impossible)
- One son to prove worthy
- His name remembered with honor

### What He Fears
- Living to see Graustein fall
- The final humiliation
- Admitting his failures
- His sons destroying each other

### Story Hooks

| Hook | Description |
|------|-------------|
| **The Succession** | Ludwig dies. Aldric and Berthold both claim lordship. Civil war within the domain. |
| **The Silver Vein** | Berthold's secret is discovered. Everyone wants control. |
| **The Blackthorne Deal** | Evidence of Aldric's treason surfaces. Expose it or exploit it? |
| **The Mercy Kill** | Someone offers to "help" Ludwig pass peacefully. Murder or mercy? |
| **The Debt Auction** | Belmont calls the loans. Graustein lands go on the block. |
